intro: Erigeron pellitus, commonly known as the whiteblue fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. Its white to pale blue flowers bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators. Erigeron pellitus is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
